Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of officer's treatment of evidence in PRRA
Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, ss. 112-116
Evidence_Assessment: Officer dismissed letters and affidavits as insufficient
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate risk upon return
Credibility_Factor: Applicant's credibility on homosexuality claim questioned
Legal_Rule: PRRA officers must reasonably assess new evidence
Procedural_Issue: Failure to consider totality of evidence and inherent difficulties in proving sexual orientation
Grounds_for_Claim: Risk of persecution based on sexual orientation
Outcome_on_Merits: Not reached â€“ procedural unreasonableness found
Applicant_Challenge: Unreasonable rejection of evidence in PRRA
Court_Result: Decision quashed, remitted to a different PRRA officer
Remedy_Sought: Judicial review, re-assessment by new officer
Resolution_Mechanism: Judicial review under subsection 72(1) of IRPA
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Past refusal due to credibility on sexual orientation
Governing_Rule: PRRA officers must conduct reasonable and fair assessment of evidence
